active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a ransomware attack on a healthcare organization with limited resources, debate how to prioritize mission-essential functions (e.g., patient care vs. billing systems) using real NIST CSF examples and BIA principles. Consider financial, operational, reputational, and safety impacts.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Business Impact Analysis (BIA) under Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity (Level 1) > 002_Incident Response And Forensics (Level 2) > 002_Incident Response Lifecycle (Level 3) > 001_Preparation (Level 4) > Asset and 002_Risk Management (Level 5) > Business Impact Analysis (BIA) (Level 6). Builds on Entry Subdomain prerequisites: asset identification and basic risk assessment. Incorporate these Learning Objectives [insert learning_objectives array]; Active Learning components [insert active_learning object] for contextual depth; Scaffolding Layers [insert scaffolding object] for progression. Generate 30 high-quality flashcards using the exact Flashcard Schema [insert flashcard_schema object]. Ensure comprehensive coverage: Balance Bloom's levels and layers; Integrate voter priorities (e.g., NIST CSF Identify, RTO/RPO, healthcare/retail scenarios); Use research context (BIA definition [guidepointsecurity.com], mission functions [csrc.nist.gov], NISTIR 8286 templates, NIST CSF full 'Identify' role in BCM/IRM). Output as JSON array of objects, each matching schema (front, back with answer/explanation/distractors/type, metadata). No additional text.
